page.title: 09Wallasey Golf Club.
page.content: Wallasey Golf Club was founded 92 years ago and is situated among the sandhills on the coast.The course was altered in 1936 and extended from 5100 to 6820 yards. It is considered a difficult course because of the prevailing wind blowing from the sea.Also the sandy soil dries the course up in summer but the sand keeps the grass dry in winter and it can be played on throughout the year. During the{2nd World War}the{Home {Guard}used the course to stop enemy tanks landing onshore by setting tank traps and lines of coiled barbed wire. The club has 415 members who mostly live in the Wallasey area.The par for the course is 72.A good golfer can score 73 because 36 is possible on the way out but it is difficult to return in 36.
